intro: Cumulopuntia ignescens, commonly known as the fire cactus, is a species of cactus native to the arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its tall, columnar stems that can reach heights of up to 10 meters. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the dry season, which are followed by spiny, spherical fruits. Its name "ignescens" refers to its fiery appearance, particularly during flowering. The plant is adapted to extreme drought conditions and thrives in well-drained soils.
